title: Trump told Israel not to kill Iran's supreme leader, says report
description: Trump told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that assassinating Khamenei was not a good idea, according to CBS.

title: Watch: Explosions and damage across Israel as Iran launches fresh air strikes
description: Five people have been killed and dozens injured, according to Israel's national emergency service.

title: 'Nowhere feels safe': Iranians on life under Israeli attacks
description: Some of those in Iran who have spoken to the BBC use one word to describe life in there right now.

title: Satellite imagery reveals damage to key Iran nuclear sites
description: Imagery from two different providers shows damage to Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: Man suspected of shooting Minnesota lawmakers arrested after huge manhunt
description: Vance Luther Boelter is accused of killing Democrat Melissa Hortman and her husband Mark, and injuring two others.

title: ‘I broke my jaw in half’: Accidents raise questions about funfair safety
description: Hundreds injured by funfair rides over the past decade, a Panorama investigation has found.

title: 'Forever chemical' scientists fear may affect reproduction found in 31 UK rivers
description: The long-term impact of the chemical on human health is still unclear and being researched.

title: MI6 appoints first female chief in 116-year history
description: Blaise Metreweli joined the Secret Intelligence Service (MI6) in 1999 and will become its 18th chief.

title: G7 summit is a big moment for Canada's PM Carney. Here are five things to watch
description: The gathering of leaders in Alberta will be a big test for Canada's new leader. We break down his challenges.

title: Chris Brown returns to Manchester for first show in city since arrest
description: The US singer is on £5m bail after being charged over an alleged assualt in a nightclub in 2023.

title: Your next Traitors fix, and Yungblud's new album: What's coming up this week
description: 28 Years Later is also released, Date Everything is here, and Benson Boone has a new album out.

title: Trump orders increase in migrant deportations
description: The president called on federal agencies to enforce the "largest mass deportation programme in history".

title: Truckloads of Scotland's rubbish will be sent to England, experts say
description: Up to 100 trucks a day could take Scotland's waste to England once a landfill ban comes in at the end of the year.

title: Rare Welsh Bible from 1588 displayed for first time
description: The rare copy of the Bible in Welsh, printed in 1588, has never been displayed before.

title: Son of Estee Lauder, who took the brand global, dies aged 92
description: Leonard Lauder joined his parents' company in 1958 and served as chief executive for 17 years.

title: Hospices are at centre of debate over assisted dying bill - what do they think?
description: As MPs debate whether to legalise assisted dying, we speak to those providing end-of-life care.

title: The Papers:  'Retreat over grooming gangs' and 'Say sorry for delay'
description: The prime minister's new call for a national inquiry into grooming gangs features in the papers.

title: The reality behind Trump's incredible investment claims
description: The president's impact on investment in the US is far more incremental than he has claimed.

title: Shared ownership: 'It's a con and we felt trapped'
description: Londoners, including couple Chris and Diana, share their experiences of shared ownership.

title: Cape Town safety fears force parents to seek former white-only schools
description: A legacy of apartheid means some black students have to go the extra mile to get a decent education.

title: Benefits reform must be pushed through, says PM
description: MPs will vote in the coming weeks on a package of measures aiming to cut the benefits bill by £5bn by 2030.

title: Asylum sites to be expanded as ministers bid to end hotel use
description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves pledged to stop using taxpayer-funded hotels to house asylum seekers by 2029.

title: Woman charged £4,586 for two-hour car park stay
description: It took three weeks for the mum to receive a refund for the accidental overcharge.

title: HS2 reports subcontractor over alleged fraud
description: The firm managing the giant rail project has shared whistleblower allegations with HMRC.

title: Ex-Syrian commander claims missing US journalist Austin Tice was executed
description: Major General Bassam Al Hassan claims former Syrian President Assad ordered Austin Tice's execution.

title: Sainsburys and Morrisons told to stop tobacco ads
description: The government has written to the supermarkets to say the adverts are banned by a law passed in 2002.

title: Airport parking fall driver leaves hospital
description: A spokesperson for the airport says the man has been discharged with "minor injuries".

title: BBC News app
description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Global News Podcast: Israel and Iran continue strikes
description: Israel launches new strikes in response to Iranian counterattacks

title: Grooming Gangs National Inquiry Announced
description: Keir Starmer has accepted recommendations from Baroness Louise Casey.

title: Spaun birdies last two to win US Open from MacIntyre
description: American JJ Spaun beats Robert MacIntyre by two shots to win his first major title on a chaotic final day at the US Open.

title: Norris 'made a fool' of himself in Piastri collision
description: Lando Norris says he "made a fool" of himself in colliding with McLaren team-mate Oscar Piastri in the Canadian Grand Prix.

title: A footballing mismatch – why were Auckland City playing Bayern Munich?
description: Bayern Munich's Club World Cup group game against Auckland City was a mismatch on the pitch - so why were the part-timers from New Zealand facing the 34-time German champions?

title: 'Some Man Utd players may have been intimidated by weight of shirt'
description: In an exclusive interview with BBC Sport, Angel Gomes discusses why players have flourished away from Manchester United and confronts suggestions his England caps are rooted in nepotism.

title: Spaun wins US Open with 64-foot birdie putt
description: JJ Spaun makes an incredible birdie putt on the 18th hole to seal US Open victory at Oakmont.
